ygData.subject: Re: Items in off had?
ygData.msgSnippet: So having the off hand free is obviously a plus, but what kind of items can you hold there (sorry I am new to this list so maybe just reply to me if this has
ygData.messageBody:
So having the off hand free is obviously a plus, but what kind of items can
you hold there (sorry I am new to this list so maybe just reply to me if
this has been posted extensively)? Also at what level can you expect to
start finding these items?

Thanks!

-Solric

-----Original Message-----
From: Keith Wiseman [mailto:keithw@...]
Sent: Wednesday, May 12, 1999 12:10 PM
To: 'eq_wizards@onelist.com'
Subject: Re: [eq_wizards] Piercing or blunt?


From: Keith Wiseman <keithw@...>

Problem is... I don't think you have a piercing upgrade 'til Stiletto and I
believe that weapon is designed to be too tough to get until Lvl 40+.
Although the RTS isn't perfect, it is pretty good and does prepare you (2H
Blunt skill) for the Observer's Staff which I think is designed for Lvl 30+.


Stats on Oberserver's Staff: Dmg 12, Delay 39, +5 INT, +5 WIS, +30 MANA

This is obviously an excellent weapon to keep in mind...

I think the information we keep seeing here lends credence to the strategy
of keeping all or at least two of your weapon skills up. I won't duplicate
that thread here ))

Draco (17) - Veeshan

-----Original Message-----
From: DSchm75588@...

Piercing is the way to go. I am an advocate of it because
of the Pugius, the
fanged skull stilleto, and the certain skull that was talked
about so many
times prior. With a Pugius right now at lvl 13, and the
skull, life is much
easier. Plus 20 mana is better than the runed staff can
provide, and the
Pugius attacks much, much quicker. I am still looking for a
fanged skull
stilleto (anyone know where to get them), but once I have
found one, life
will be much easier.
Zaeq, Wizard of E'ci
